fields.description:
There are at least 4 different versions of different core Spring framework libraries being included in WEB-INF/lib:

* spring-aop-2.0.8.jar
* spring-beans-2.5.6.jar
* spring-context-2.5.6.SEC02.jar
* spring-web-2.0.6.jar

In version 4.2.4 (which we are upgrading from), there were no Spring libraries being included so we had been pulling in 2.5.6 as part of our custom authenticator.  Now that Atlassian is including some of the Spring libraries in the core build, in theory we should have just been able to leverage these instead of including our own -- but the mismatch of the AOP library is making our code break and we don't want to override a bundled library version that came with the product and break something else.

What gives, is this intentional or accidental?  Can you guys make these versions consistent so if someone needs to pull in another Spring jar file we can logically know which version we should include?
fields.summary: Spring library madness in distributed WAR file
Mail config page should not forget the password
Need to have a way to set the maximumum JDBC timeout for DBCP

fields.description:
During the 4.4 upgrade, we now convert custom fields to store IDs instead of the direct values. In certain circumstances this upgrade can take a long time (a 200k issue instance with ~80 custom fields took about 30 minutes) but there is no indication in the logs that there is any work being done.

Could we indicate that progress is being made, perhaps a "Converting field X of Y" type of indication in the logs to let us know that the upgrade is still going ahead.
fields.summary: Progress Indicator when converting custom fields during 4.4 upgrade

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-25667].
  {panel}

I would like to request that Jira incorporate an option to use the diff Unified Output Format for all text field changes. As is now, the full text is displayed twice and users must manually determine the differences. This works for small bodies of text but is very problematic for large bodies. This can greatly reduce the size of notifications and history.

We currently see:

{code}Ryan Steed updated TICKET-1234:
---------------------------

    Description: 
Test ticket. Testing...
1
2
3




  was:
Test ticket.
{code}

But would like to see something like:

{code}Ryan Steed updated TICKET-1234:
---------------------------

    Description: 
--- 2011-09-12 15:23:29.000000000 -0600
+++ 2011-09-12 15:23:14.000000000 -0600
@@ -1 +1,4 @@
-Test ticket.
+Test ticket. Testing...
+1
+2
+3
{code}
fields.summary: Implement optional diff Unified Output Format for Change History and Ticket Update Email Notifications

fields.description:
I experienced already several times the following problem. There is a issue in JIRA in Project A, for which the tasks are already created for Version "Sprint N". Now I have to move this issue from project A to project B. I do it going into the backlog item itself and pressing the action "Move". After several steps and confirmations the backlog item has been successfully moved to project B to the Version "Sprint N". But! All its tasks have lost their assignment to the "Sprint N" and get the Version "Unassigned" instead.

This is problem as a user needs reassign all tasks manually to  Sprint N for every issue.
fields.summary: Tasks are getting lost if Issue moved to other project
Order of Non-custom Field in The 'View Issue' page is Ignored by default, It should be handler more gracefully
Add Information That Certificate Might Need To Be Imported To JIRA's JRE for JIRA 4.4
Option to create JIRA installation directory as a non-root user

fields.summary: Javadocs for IssueService.validateSubTaskCreate() are misleading

fields.description:
Having uploaded a custom avatar for a project, later change Default Assignee to 'Unassigned' and save. The project avatar is returned to the default avatar.

The custom avatar is not lost and can be re-selected, but should remain selected.
fields.summary: Changing the Default Assignee for a project to 'Unassigned' causes the avatar to change
Create/Edit Issue Page needs CREATE/UPDATE button at the TOP.

fields.description:
A normal JIRA user can not create a shared dashboard/filter that has the same name as another dashboard/filter
However when administrating shares we can change the owner of a share and there is no validation done on the share name
this means that we can come into a situation where a user has two shares with the same name

when the user comes to click on one of these shares, JIRA throws an error:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Passed List had more than one value. 

The current work around is for the user to rename one of the shares.
fields.summary: Changing the owner of a dashboard or filter fails silently if a dashboard with the same name is already owned by the new owner

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-25653].
  {panel}

From a project management perspective the way our team works is that we estimate at the Story level and then have the developers creates sub-tasks and log their work at the sub-task level.  The issue we have is that the time logged against the sub-task does not reduce the remaining estimate we did at the Story level.  This allows us to do a top-down style of estimation. If there could be an option to allow you to select where you want your time rolled up to, or have a preference on how time tracking works, it would be appreciated.

Example:
* Story is estimated at 16 hours
* Several sub-tasks are created with no estimations
* 4 hours worth of work is done against a sub-task
* Remaining time left on Story to be 12 hours
fields.summary: Estimate at Parent Story, Log work at Sub-task

fields.description:
I am unable to add a user to a project role unless they are already linked to at least one project role. 

I am attempting to do this via Administration > General > Users and then select the "Project Roles" link for that user. 

If there is already a project role listed for the user, then the "Edit Project Roles" button leads to a screen where there is a 'Display Project' link. 

This link allows additional projects to be added to the list. However, if there is no project role listed, then the "Edit Project Roles for User" screen does not have the 'Display Project' link.

In this case, the only way to add the user to the project appears to be from the Administration Dashboard for the specific project, which is not very effective if trying to manage adding a user to roles across multiple projects.
fields.summary: Cannot add users to project roles if they are not member of any role yet

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-25640].
  {panel}


originally copied from this comment
{quote}Function linkedIssues() only shows the issues linked to a particular issue, I want to find all issues those are linked to other issues marked by a specific link type, e.g., "is blocked by".
{quote}
This function could incorporate querying issues that are linked _to any issue_ with a given link type and bearing in mind that links have two identities, one in each direction, the link type could be direction specific or not.
h4. Examples
 # find all issues that are duplicates of issue JRA-25640 (one direction, issue specified)
 # find all issues that are blocking issue JRA-25640 or that JRA-25640 blocks (bidirectional, issue specified)
 # find all issues that are duplicates of any issue, or which duplicate any issue (bidirectional, no issue specified)
 # find all issues that are blocked (one direction, no issue specified)
 # find all issues that are linked to a specific issue and display those based on a specific depth (linked issues displaying linked relationship two, three, etc., issues deep)

h4. Implementation Notes
 * The JQL function that exists must continue to work exactly as it does. If it is possible to overload the JQL function based on arity and this makes a consistent API, then this would be preferred. Otherwise, there may need to be a new function name which provides vararg behaviour as described above.
 * The link index entries added in 4.4 (I think) provide enough to build performant lucene queries for the above use cases. What's missing is the JQL function plumbing.
fields.summary: JQL function for showing all issues linked to any issue by a given issue link type

fields.description:
With JIRA 4.3+ we require users to use InnoDB storage engine when integrating  with MySQL

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+MySQL#ConnectingJIRAtoMySQL-2.CreateandConfiguretheMySQLDatabase

However, this isn't the default engine for MySQL (MYISAM) also for various reason ppl may not wish to change the default engine to suite our application.

Anyway, this request is completely unnecessary as MySQL allows to define _storage_engine_ as an attribute for a session.

Funny enough other ATL product already use it... Confluence or Bamboo:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/MySQL+5.x

Unaware users will see in fatal errors in their log file:
{noformat}
2011-06-01 23:26:55,334 main ERROR      [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] SQL Exception while executing the following:
CREATE INDEX idx_goup_attr_dir_name_lval ON cwd_group_attributes (directory_id, attribute_name, lower_attribute_value)
Error was: com.mysql.jdbc.exceptions.jdbc4.MySQLSyntaxErrorException: Specified key was too long; max key length is 1000 bytes
SQL Exception while executing the following:
CREATE UNIQUE INDEX uk_group_attr_name_lval ON cwd_group_attributes (group_id, attribute_name, lower_attribute_value)
{noformat}

Currently our configurer (config.sh/bat) does not allow to set this attribute on the connection.
fields.summary: Create MySQL tables using InnoDB engine by default - session variable

fields.description:
Sometimes JIRA is not able to startup and got into the error: "The system cannot find the path specified"

Happened in Windows Service and manual way to startup (/bin/startup.bat):
!windows_service.jpg!
!startup_bat.png!

*Cause*
Inside {{setenv.bat}}:
{noformat}
rem --------------------------------------------------------------------------
set JAVA_OPTS=%JAVA_OPTS% -Xms%JVM_MINIMUM_MEMORY% -Xmx%JVM_MAXIMUM_MEMORY% %JVM_REQUIRED_ARGS% %DISABLE_NOTIFICATIONS% %JVM_SUPPORT_RECOMMENDED_ARGS%

set _PRG_DIR=%~dp0

type %_PRG_DIR%\jirabanner.txt

rem Checks if the JAVA_HOME has a space in it (can cause issues)
{noformat}
The command {{type %_PRG_DIR%\jirabanner.txt}} should be {{type "%_PRG_DIR%\jirabanner.txt"}}.

This command is correct in JIRA 4.3
fields.summary: The system cannot find the path specified when starting JIRA in Windows

Re:Inception
When doing upgrades/uninstalls we need to stop jira and then perform some operations, backup dirs on upgrade and delete files and user account on uninstall.

We have noticed that quite often jira will not stop in timely fashion and on some occasion it will run forever. 
{noformat}
INFO: Stopping service Catalina
Apr 18, 2011 6:01:49 PM org.apache.catalina.loader.WebappClassLoader clearReferencesThreads
SEVERE: The web application [] appears to have started a thread named [QuartzWorker-0] but has failed to stop it. This is very likely to create a memory leak.

This is very likely to create a memory leak.

Using standalone Crowd as an external directory (internal directory disabled):
* create a user (the 'original' user),
* add the user to some groups,
* delete the user,
* create a new user with same username,
* remove them from all groups,
* restart JIRA.

After JIRA restarts, the user will be in all the groups the original user was in, and it will be impossible to remove them from any of these groups.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

- Turn off 'User Searching By Full Name' in JIRA General Configuration
- Administer a project's project roles
- click into the user search field and start typing a user's name

This results in 

{quote}Begin typing to find users.
The value sysadmin is invalid.{quote}

Searching on the group side of things works perfectly.

Nice to haves:
- Better documentation around this option, there's nothing that says you need this feature enabled so that you can edit project roles (searching for users, etc).
- While it's disabled, valid usernames fail, so either having an old user picker would be an option or a note saying, "Turn on 'User Searching By Full Name' to enable this feature."
fields.summary: Not able to grant users project role permissions while 'User Searching By Full Name' is OFF

fields.description:
If you are using Chrome and you set your zoom level to over 140%, the description field will shrink when you type in it.

Steps to reproduce:

1) Start Chrome
2) Log into Jira
3) Click "Create Issue" in the upper right hand corner and select a project and type, click create
4) Click settings in the upper right hand corner (the little wrench)
5) Click the + next to zoom twice (you should end up at 144%)
6) Scroll down to the Description field and start typing

The Description field starts to shrink vertically as you type.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-25599].
  {panel}

In the "normal" Issue-Detail-Screen you just see the Issue-ID and the status of any linked Issue.
Our own customers and developers want to have the Issue-Icon before the Issue-ID so that they see whether the linked Issue is a Bug or a Feature or whatever.

Some of our Developers reviewed the Code and made a suggestion:

Before Jira 4.3 the file ../webapp/includes/snippets/issuelinksmall.jsp have to be edited
In Jira 4.3 the Linked-Issue-Section changed: webapp/includes/panels/issue/view_linking.jsp

In those Files there is a section {{<td class="issuekey">}} and after that the {{<a href="...">}}
Between those 2 Tags we added the following: {{<%@ include file="/includes/icons/type.jsp" %>}} which includes the Issue-Icon right before the Issue-ID.

I think that would be a nice improvement for all JIRA-Customers and Users. Maybe you will insert that simple code into your next Release?

Cheers
André
fields.summary: Show Issue-Icon for Linked-Issues in Issue-Detail-Screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-25596].
  {panel}

In JIRA v5.0 we are creating a separate API module for plugin developers to depend on to give more security that the plugin will remain compatible with future JIRA versions.

Plugins devs can change the dependency on "atlassian-jira" to "jira-api" in their maven pom.xml like so:
{code}
        <dependency>
            <groupId>com.atlassian.jira</groupId>
            <artifactId>jira-api</artifactId>
            <version>${jira.version}</version>
            <scope>provided</scope>
        </dependency>     
{code}

This issue is intended to gather feedback on what is included and what isn't included, and is of particular interest for JIRA v5.0 Early Access releases (milestones and betas).
fields.summary: Feedback for Java API

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-25595].
  {panel}

For some time now - at least since 2008 when I first drew this to Atlassian's attention - the configuration file entityengine.xml uses an incorrect JNDI binding for looking up UserTransaction.

The correct JNDI binding for applications to look up UserTransaction at runtime is:
   java:comp/UserTransaction.

See the JavaEE Specification EE6.8 page 153:
"JTA defines the UserTransaction interface that is used by applications to start, and commit or abort transactions. Application components get a UserTransaction object through a JNDI lookup using the name java:comp/UserTransaction or by requesting injection of a UserTransaction object."

Using the non-spec compliant binding of java:comp/env/UserTransaction probably works on Tomcat, but is not guaranteed to work on any other container. At this point let me declare my interest here as one of the core Jetty developers. That notwithstanding, surely it is in Atlassian's interests to be as container agnostic as possible? Especially on such a trivial issue.

Moreover, as JIRA is a well-known application no doubt many users would assume it uses industry best-practice and would copy this unfortunately incorrect and non-spec compliant configuration.

I again urge the JIRA developers to stick with spec compliance and simply fix the JNDI name configured in entityengine.xml.
fields.summary: entityengine.xml configuration for java:comp/env/UserTransaction is incorrect

fields.description:
We have identified and fixed a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in JIRA administration interface.

Affected version is JIRA 4.3.x

XSS vulnerabilities potentially allow an attacker to embed their own JavaScript into a JIRA page. You can read more about XSS attacks at various places on the web, including these:

* cgisecurity.com: http://www.cgisecurity.com/articles/xss-faq.shtml
* The Web Application Security Consortium: http://projects.webappsec.org/Cross-Site+Scripting

This issue is reported in our security advisory on this page:

* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+Security+Advisory+2011-09-27

Updates for JIRA Bamboo Plugin are at https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/4946
fields.summary: XSS Vulnerability in Administration Interface of JIRA Bamboo Plugin

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-25591].
  {panel}

In JIRA 4.4 the notification templates has changed(see [JRA-12640|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-12640]) including the action performed on the sender (from field)(see attachment notification_jira_44.jpg), which was located on the notification subject in previous versions (see attachment notification_jira_43.jpg).

I raised this new feature to turn "_action_ at the sender ('from' field) optional", where the customer can choose which whether to enable this change or leave it, as it better fits to his business needs.

h3. Workaround for Subjects:
[JIRA Email Subjects Changed After Upgrade to 4.4.3|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/JIRA+Email+Subjects+Changed+After+Upgrade+to+4.4.3]

It occurs either JIRA Toolkit jar file is located at {{<JIRA_HOME>/plugins/installed-plugins}} or {{<JIRA_INSTALL>/WEB-INF/lib}}.

h2.Cause

This error occurs due to an incompatibility JIRA Toolkit plugin 0.18 and Greenhopper 5.7.1. Although the causes are not known yet, it apparently points to a class/even type that doesn't exists in Greenhopper. Thus this exception is thrown.

h2.Workaround

Disable the *JIRA Toolkit plugin 0.18* via Universal Plugin Manager and restart your instance. The error no longer appears so.

{panel:borderStyle=solid| borderColor=#ccc| titleBGColor=#F7D6C1| bgColor=#FFFFCE}*In some specific cases*, this error was also triggered by an issue between JIRA installed and the bundled version that 4.4 ships. Once Greenhopper implements a specific custom field type "Greenhopper Ranking", JIRA searches for the events related with this one but do it inside the bundled plugin (even disabled). That case, do the following:

# Backup your data.
# Go to _Administration > Plugins > Manage Existing > Greenhopper > Uninstall_ and remove the user-installed version of Greenhopper.
# Restart your JIRA instance.
# Go to _Administration > Plugins > Show System Plugins > Greenhopper > Enable_ enabling the system embedded version.
# Go to _Administration > Plugins > Upgrade_ and proceed upgrading Greenhopper.
# Go to {{<JIRA_INSTALL>/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes}}, do a security copy of the file *atlassian-bundled-plugins.zip* (all bundled plugins are extracted from there), open this file and delete the jar *jira-greenhopper-plugin-5.7-disabled.jar*.
# Restart your instance.
# Try to add a comment on the issue and see if the issue has gone.

This procedure is supposed to avoid JIRA from using the *jar* file of the bundled version of Grenhopper.

OR

# Go to GreenHopper General Config and turn off the GreenHopper night service
# Restart JIRA
{panel}
fields.summary: Incompatibility between JIRA Toolkit plugin 0.18 and Greenhopper 5.7.1 when running JIRA 4.4 - Stacktrace during editing/commenting/etc
Add a replacement to jira.extension.container.provider in JIRA 4.3 onwards
Add translation feature for custom field.

fields.description:
According to [Advance Searching document|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Advanced+Searching#AdvancedSearching-OriginalEstimate]:

{quote}
Search for issues where the Original Estimate is set to a particular value (i.e. a number, not a date or date range).

Use "w", "d", "h" and "m" to specify weeks, days, hours or minutes.
{quote}

However searching issues using day unit "d" doesn't work as expected.

*Step to reproduce*
 Setup:
# Create Issue A with Original estimate : 2d
# Create Issue B Original estimate : 16h

Test search using different operator ">",">=","=","<" and "<="

">" operator
||Query||Returned Result||Status||
|project="TST" AND originalEstimate > 1d|  0 | (x)|
|project="TST" AND originalEstimate > 8h|  2 |(/)|
\\

">=" operator
||Query||Returned Result||Status||
|project="TST" AND originalEstimate >= 1d | 0 |(x)|
|project="TST" AND originalEstimate >= 8h | 2 |(/)|
\\

"=" operator
||Query||Returned Result||Status||
|project="TST" AND originalEstimate = 2d  |0 | (x)|
|project="TST" AND originalEstimate = 16h  |2  |(/)|
\\

"<" operator
||Query||Returned Result||Status||
|project="TST" AND originalEstimate < 3d  |2  |(/)|
|project="TST" AND originalEstimate < 24h | 2 | (/)|
\\

"<=" operator
||Query||Returned Result||Status||
|project="TST" AND originalEstimate <= 3d  |2 | (/)|
|project="TST" AND originalEstimate <= 24h  |2  |(/)|
\\


*Conclusion*
Search using day unit "d" doesn't work with operator ">" , ">="  and "="
fields.summary: Search Original Estimate using unit "d" doesn't work in Advance Search

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-25567].
  {panel}

If you have issues with long summaries, then the order of sorting will not be respected.

h4. Steps to Reproduce.
# Create issues with a long summary.
{noformat}
Test Issue With Long Summary and even even even Longer - A
Test Issue With Long Summary and even even even Longer - B
Test Issue With Long Summary and even even even Longer - C
Test Issue With Long Summary and even even even Longer - Z
{noformat}
# Go to *Issue Navigator* and search for issues in the project where the issues above were created.
# Sort results by _Summary_.
# It can be seen that the order of sorting is not respected (see screen capture below):
!Issue Navigator.png!

h4. Extra information.
Tested with JIRA 4.2, 4.3 and 4.4.
h4.November, 22nd 2013 update
This is still happening on the latest version in OnDemand as of today (6.2-OD-03)
fields.summary: Sorting Mismatch when Dealing with Issues with Long Summary
